Class DBHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • DBHandler

  • public class DBHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    Handles all requests to the SQL database

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      DBHandler()
      Uses class variables url, username, and password to connected to the database.

      • select

                                 java.lang.String selection,
                                 java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> conditions)
        Runs a selection query on the database.
        Parameters:
        table - name of the table
        selection - what to return
        conditions - conditionals (i.e. 'id=1')
        Returns:
        a ResultSet object that contains the data produced by the given query; never null

      • adjustPartQuantity

        public int adjustPartQuantity(int partId,
                              int adjustment)
        Adjusts a part quantity by a given amount in the STOCKROOM database
        Parameters:
        partId - the ID of the part, integer
        adjustment - the amount the quantity should be adjusted, signed integer
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing

      • setPartQuantity

        public int setPartQuantity(int partId,
                           int quantity)
        Set the quantity of a part by an amount
        Parameters:
        partId - id of the part in the STOCKROOM database
        quantity - quantity to set
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing

      • createTable

        public int createTable(java.lang.String tableName,
                       java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> dataList)
        Creates a table.
        Parameters:
        tableName - name of new table
        dataList - ArrayList of sql-formatted strings; ie {"FirstName CHAR(100)", "LastName CHAR(50)"}
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing

      • update

        public int update(java.lang.String tableName,
                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> updates,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object[]> searchConditions)
        Creates a valid SQL UPDATE String and applies it to the database.
        Parameters:
        tableName - the name of the table
        updates - a HashMap of the updates to be performed, where the column in the key, and the new value is the value
        searchConditions - an ArrayList of Object arrays of size 3. Each Object array's first two indices contain Strings representing first the column identifier to compare and second, the SQL comparator. The third index contains the value to search for. This could be a String, a double, on an int.
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing

      • insert

        public int insert(java.lang.String tableName,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> columns,
                  java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Object> values)
        Allows adding a row to a table
        Parameters:
        tableName - name of the table to add a row to
        columns - columns to be added (optional)
        values - values to add
        Returns:
        either (1) the row count for SQL Data Manipulation Language (DML) statements or (2) 0 for SQL statements that return nothing
